channel.title: shu on Alexander Lab @ WHOI
channel.description: Recent content in shu on Alexander Lab @ WHOI

item.title: Keeping my R life organized
item.description: I recently found myself setting up a new computer, spinning up ~23864283.34 new projects in R, and wanting to stay somewhat organized in the process. After doing some digging, I decided to give Anaconda environments a try to keep my various R environments in order. I have decided to share my process. Installing Anaconda First, let’s make sure Anaconda is installed. If you do not have Anaconda, follow instructions here to install.

Sarah is a Postdoctoral Fellow at WHOI investigating the ecological roles microbial eukaryotes play in marine ecosystems. She is currently focused on characterizing the microbial eukaryotic communities found at deep sea hydrothermal vents to understand their place in marine food webs in the deep biosphere.
